issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Install XCode 2.3.3
Run sudo xcode-select -switch /Developer/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer
Launch Ti Studio
Open app that complied under SDK 1.8.2 and XCode 2.2
Select Ti SDK 2.0.2 in TiApp, save
Clean project
Toss old folder in sim
Select Build in IOS Sim

h3. Actual Result

[INFO] One moment, building ...
[INFO] Titanium SDK version: 2.0.2 (05/30/12 10:21 2ff31a3)
[INFO] iPhone Device family: iphone
[INFO] iPhone SDK version: 5.1
[INFO] iPhone simulated device: iphone
[INFO] Launching application in Simulator
dyld: Library not loaded: @rpath/DevToolsFoundation.framework/Versions/A/DevToolsFoundation
  Referenced from: /Developer/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Platforms/iPhoneSimulator.platform/Developer/Library/PrivateFrameworks/iPhoneSimulatorRemoteClient.framework/Versions/A/iPhoneSimulatorRemoteClient
  Reason: image not found

h3. Expected Result
Sim launched with app.
fields.summary: Can't launch simulator in Ti 2.0.2 against XCode 2.3.3 w/ iOS SDK 5.1

comments.body: Well I put XCode 4.3.3 into the "default" directory (/Applications) and it works.  When I move it anywhere else it does not.  You can close this.
